alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and southern Albany Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Lost Creek Campground, or 45 miles northeast of Craig, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Rawlins, Albany, Saratoga, Encampment, Sinclair, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Grand Encampment, Six Mile Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Teton Reservoir, The Buttes, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Arlington, Hutton Lake, Hog Park Reservoir, French Creek Campground and Yellow Pine Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 209 and 335. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
